Today we thank the brave men and women who donned the uniform in service to our nation. Their sacrifices preserve the freedoms that America was built on and continue to make it great to this day.  Every Veterans Day, I think of the men and women I served with in the U.S. Navy Reserve and their dedication to our country. I also think of my father who served in Europe during World War II, and how grateful I am for his bravery and that of his generation. Most of all, I think of the men and women I have met who are veterans of our most recent conflicts, and how they instill in me the confidence that America remains the greatest country in the world.  Let us never fail to honor everyone who has served, for they have truly honored us with their heroism. Thank you and Happy Veterans Day.

Michigan is uniquely positioned to lead the way in driving innovation in green energy technologies like electric vehicles and advancing environmental and conservation policies that create 21st century jobs and preserve our Great Lakes for generations to come.We are happy to announce the Sierra Club's endorsement of U.S. Senator Gary Peters for his 2020 re-election! We are deeply grateful to Senator Gary Peters for his work protecting Michigan‚Äôs freshwater, from securing funding to improve water infrastructure in Flint, to fighting to clean up toxic PFAS chemicals in drinking water. He is a true environmental champion who will fight to protect Michigan‚Äôs clean air, clean water, our climate, and the Great Lakes.

I am heartbroken for the victims and affected families in El Paso and Dayton. If two mass shootings in less than 24 hours doesn't convince you that we need to do more as a country to combat gun violence, I don't know what will. This is an epidemic.  And it's not just about the horrific incidents we see in the national news. Families are torn apart by gun violence every single day. It kills more than 36,000 Americans a year.  There are commonsense steps that we could be taking right now to curb gun violence, but Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans have prevented us from even voting on them. We can't wait any longer. The time for action is NOW. #EnoughIsEnough

I‚Äôm very excited that the Democratic candidates are coming to Detroit for next week's presidential debates. I wrote an open letter to them about some key issues I believe our nominee must address to win Michigan. You can read it here: https://medium.com/@PetersForMichigan/an-open-letter-to-the-democratic-candidates-96a00a1fb9c1 - We have no more important resource in Michigan than our water. It is central to our way of life. I hope the candidates talk about protecting our Great Lakes and ensuring clean drinking water. - If given a fair shot, Michigan's workers can outcompete anyone. I hope to hear how they will fight for working families, strengthen unions, and expand job training to make sure anyone can get the skills they need to find a good-paying job.  - Michiganders are feeling the squeeze of rising health care costs, especially prescription drug prices. Some even cross the border into Canada to seek out lower prices for life-saving medications. I hope to hear their plans to reverse this trend.  - Our nominee must recognize that MI's diversity is its greatest strength. Communities across our state have felt the sting of discrimination under the current administration. I urge the candidates to fight to reverse their discriminatory policies and stand up for all Michiganders. Michigan can never be taken for granted. Our voters and our issues must be a priority. The road to the White House runs through MI so I hope the candidates will be here early and often.
